title: Shot gun confiscated from disgruntled resident who threatened to shoot Bebo millionaire's 'noisy' building works
text:
Police have confiscated a shotgun from a fed-up resident who threatened to shoot building works - in a village being renovated by a 'Bebo' millionaire.

John Heath, 72, says he made the threat after becoming annoyed by the noise, vehicles and disruption caused by super-rich Michael Birch.

Birch, 49, helped set-up several social networking sites including Bebo - which he sold for $850 million in 2008.

Wealthy Birch, who was born in the UK, made his millions in San Francisco before returning to Wooslery in Devon.

He used to visit family as a boy and his great-great grandfather also lived there.

Birch and his wife have since bought the local pub, fish and chip shop, village store, manor house, several properties as well as 90 acres of farmland.

But while many villagers have welcomed the investment and the restoration of numerous ageing buildings, others say it has caused far too much disruption.

The noise and heavy traffic even prompted him to scrawl the words "Birch out of our lives" in paint on a corrugated tin shed.

And anger boiled over this week when police were forced to confiscate a shotgun belonging to John after he threatened to shoot the electric supply.
description: Police have confiscated a shotgun from a fed-up resident who threatened to shoot building works - in a village being renovated by a 'Bebo' millionaire.
